definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: This system encourages not only internal promotions but lateral moves as well.
sentences.chinese: 该系统不仅鼓励内部升职也支持平职调换。

sentences.english: This morning I went to the shop to change the coat I bought yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨我去服装店调换我昨天在那买的一件衣服。

sentences.english: Ensure all used amenities are replaced especially laundry bags and laundry lists.
sentences.chinese: 调换所有用过的客用品特别是洗衣袋和洗衣单。

sentences.english: If the first number is higher than the second, switch them.
sentences.chinese: 如果第一个数比第二个大，就将那两个数调换。

sentences.english: Repair or replace the electric brush; clean the commutator surface by abrasive paper and blow it clean.
sentences.chinese: 修理或调换电刷，用木砂纸清理整流子表面，并吹净。

sentences.english: Constant reshuffles of staff bear unfavourably on the quality of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 经常调换教师对教学质量有不利影响。

sentences.english: He went back to the shop and changed that shirt for a larger one.
sentences.chinese: 他返回商店把那件衬衣调换成一件大一些的。

sentences.english: Swapplictogether withioned his mom to buy Yvonne whtogether with she need-o.
sentences.chinese: 用他母亲去调换伊芳必要的东西。

sentences.english: And the Russian government switched urine samples allowing athletes to pass doping tests.
sentences.chinese: 而且俄罗斯政府调换了尿样让运动员通过兴奋剂检测。

sentences.english: Their positions were reversed; John played centre forward and Tom played fullback.
sentences.chinese: 他们的位置调换了，约翰踢中锋，汤姆改踢后卫。

sentences.english: Do not replace fuses when standing on a moist floor.
sentences.chinese: 不要站在潮湿地板上调换熔断器。

sentences.english: Goods can be exchanged only on production of a sale slip .
sentences.chinese: 商品可凭售货单进行调换。

sentences.english: We will replace a new card and inform you within 7 working days.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在7个工作日内通知您，并给您调换新卡。

sentences.english: You show it to them again, they'll sometimes accuse us of switching the tape.
sentences.chinese: 如果再给他们看一遍，他们会认为我们调换了磁带。

sentences.english: Goods can be exchange only on production of a sale slip .
sentences.chinese: 商品可凭售货单进行调换。

sentences.english: They carefully designed that the two trunks exactly alike would be switched in the waiting room.
sentences.chinese: 他们精心设计了在候车室调换两只相同行李箱的方法。

definition: to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
to replace (a worn-out tire etc)/to change (one's address etc)
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
to dismiss and replace (sb)/to replace (sb or sth)
to convert/to turn into (sth else)/to adapt (a story to another medium)
